title: [Large-Scale] Social Studies Instructional Design and Technology Integration Education Using 3D Virtual Learning Environments

context.prior_knowledge: Basic instructional design theories, experience with educational technology tools, and foundational understanding of social studies subjects (history/geography/culture)
context.additional_context: Conducting interaction-centered social education instructional design practices in Mozilla Hubs-based 3D virtual learning environments. Emphasizes strengthening civic competencies and technology integration skills through learner collaboration. Includes simulation activities tailored to social studies characteristics, such as historical event reenactments, geographical space exploration, and cultural context analysis.

learning_goals: Learners can create exhibits applying instructional design principles to social education content (history, geography, culture, etc.) in a 3D virtual environment
Learners can propose improved social phenomenon simulation designs reflecting peer feedback using VR-based collaboration tools
Learners can integrate core elements of technical education (learner autonomy, stepwise task design) into social problem-solving simulations

resources: BYOD (Bring Your Own Device) Support Guide Document

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
